meanings.definition: A basic dye used in biological staining.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used thionin to color the cells for observation.
meanings.sent2: Biologists often rely on thionin to highlight specific structures under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student accidentally spilled thionin on the lab coat, turning it purple.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic mind saw the world through thionin-tinted glasses, finding beauty in every detail.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant hue of thionin made the microscopic world come alive in vivid colors.

meanings.definition: A chemical compound with antifungal properties.
meanings.sent1: The pharmacist recommended thionin to treat the fungal infection on his foot.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use thionin to protect crops from harmful fungi.
meanings.sent3: The antifungal properties of thionin saved the day in the battle against mold.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like thionin, fighting off negativity and growing stronger each day.
meanings.sent5: The powerful antifungal action of thionin cleared the garden of any harmful molds.
